summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP Captain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and circumstances surrounding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, manipulative behavior, the July 23 incident, and the failure to maintain a cellmate and complete required checks leading up to his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate at MCC who was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019. The interview details his behavior, housing status, and the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The BOP Captain interviewed by the FBI. He oversaw security at MCC, was responsible for implementing directives regarding Epstein's housing, and recounts the events and procedures before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The MCC Warden who directed that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times. The Captain reported potential cellmate candidates to him.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Notified by the Captain on the morning of Epstein's death. Later informed the Captain about staff admissions regarding failed procedures.

persons.name: Lieutenant

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Took over SHU responsibilities on August 9, 2019, when the SHU Lieutenant was on leave. Was aware Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Relieved Lieutenant on the night of August 9, 2019, working the 10 PM - 6 AM shift. The Captain did not personally tell her Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Called the Captain around 7:00 AM on August 10, 2019, to report Epstein was found unresponsive and stated Epstein had no cellmate.

connections.description: The Captain was the security supervisor responsible for Epstein's housing and supervision at MCC.
The Captain reported to the Warden, implemented his directives regarding Epstein, and submitted cellmate candidates for his review.
The Captain directly supervised the SHU Lieutenant and repeatedly directed him that Epstein needed a cellmate.
The Warden issued the directive that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times and was notified when a cellmate was assigned.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate flagged staff. Epstein claimed his cellmate tried to kill him. He was placed on Suicide Watch for a week.

events.title: Epstein's Last Day
events.description: Epstein had an attorney session. His cellmate, , was at court and later released. Epstein's property was removed from his cell, indicating a potential transfer/discharge. He was left without a cellmate. He reportedly made a phone call around 7:00 PM.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell without a cellmate. Lieutenant notified Captain around 7:00 AM. Staff admitted to not completing 30-minute rounds or the 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM counts.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The Captain of MCC was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding the supervision and circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, without a cellmate present, contrary to the Warden's directive.
The Captain stated that staff admitted to failing to complete the required 30-minute rounds and the 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM inmate counts on the night of Epstein's death.
The camera surveillance system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) was reportedly down, and the Captain was not aware of this until the morning he asked to review footage after Epstein's death.

Epstein had exhibited manipulative behavior to avoid having a cellmate, including requesting psychological evaluations and was placed on Suicide Watch after a July 23 incident where he was found unresponsive.

Communication breakdowns occurred: the Captain gave verbal, informal instructions about Epstein's cellmate requirement to Lieutenants, but no formal meeting or email was held, and the Lieutenant on duty the night of Epstein's death was not personally told.
